page.title: 14PUMPING STATION,BAUNTON.
page.content: At the Baunton pumping station two bore holes have been drilled 70m under the ground. The water is pumped through a submersible pump to the surface. It is then collected into a tank. Chlorine is put into the water so that it kills all germs. Super chlorine is then put into the water to make it even clearer. Finally Sodium dioxide is mixed with the water to eliminate the taste of the chlorine. Once the water is clean it is pumped uphill about 1.6 km to the reservoir on the Gloucester Road. The reservoir is on high land so that water from it can flow downhill into the town of Cirencester. It is stored underground because if it touches the surface germs will get back into it.
